alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 11:27PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Kit Carson County through MIDNIGHT MDT... At 1126 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles north of Vona, or 8 miles northeast of Seibert, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Kit Carson County. This includes Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 408 and 426. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
